Install a webserver (apache)

You would have to google it because i dont know how to explain it

did you remove with --purge?  (or "complete removal" in synaptic?)  What are screenlets?  User space configuration?  That won't be removed with uninstall, just delete the config file(s) in your homedir.
so i need to open up synaptic
What are screenlets?
you're tryign to get rid of your user configed settings, right?  not global settings?
yes for screenlets
it says its removing confg files
you would like screenlets

right.  You'll want to open up your homedir, and remove whatever screenlet configuration files there are (.screenlet maybe?  might be a file or a directory).  You'll need to show hidden files to be able to see it, at any rate.
just dont use the mail one
how can i see hidden files
that "configuration files" are global ones, not user ones.  In nautilus, ctrl-H (maybe it's alt, I dontknow View > Show Hidden Files)
there as cool as beryl
